      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void classifyFromSwitch(WorkerSwitch workerSwitch)
      route and rewrite packet_in messages from switch to controller if it's lldp, do the lldp decode stuff else, look up the embedded packet's controller(s) by flowspace and send to them Murad is originated from active switch? yes, is cloned? no, forward yes, save xid and swID forward no, originated from cloned switch? no, drop yes, save xid and swID map to active switch, slicer forwatd
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      FVPacketIn setPacketData(byte[] packetData) 
      void sliceFromController(WorkerSwitch workerSwitch, OriginalSwitch fvSlicer)
      Send a sliced version of this message to the switch Sliced could mean rewritten or not sent at all (if the policy does not allow it)
      void topologyController(TopologyConnection topologyConnection)
      The topologyController handles LLDP messages and ignores everything else

      • classifyFromSwitch

        public void classifyFromSwitch(WorkerSwitch workerSwitch)
        route and rewrite packet_in messages from switch to controller if it's lldp, do the lldp decode stuff else, look up the embedded packet's controller(s) by flowspace and send to them Murad is originated from active switch? yes, is cloned? no, forward yes, save xid and swID forward no, originated from cloned switch? no, drop yes, save xid and swID map to active switch, slicer forwatd
        Specified by:
        classifyFromSwitch in interface Classifiable
        Parameters:
        workerSwitch - Switch state

      • sliceFromController

        public void sliceFromController(WorkerSwitch workerSwitch,
                       OriginalSwitch fvSlicer)
        Description copied from interface: Slicable
        Send a sliced version of this message to the switch Sliced could mean rewritten or not sent at all (if the policy does not allow it)
        Specified by:
        sliceFromController in interface Slicable
        Parameters:
        workerSwitch - The potential destination
        fvSlicer - The slicing policy and source of the message
